</div><div id="menu-Ns-MKsITVDO07VLR0x0" class="flyout"></div></div><div class="message desc" data-messageid="-Ns-NrT4fpxfRUcdHpLi"><div class="spacer"></div> The war is finally over. For some, it’s felt over for decades, lingering overlong like the winter chill—and now, in its passing, celebrations spring throughout Meander.<div id="menu-Ns-NrT4fpxfRUcdHpLi" class="flyout"></div></div><div class="message desc" data-messageid="-Ns-NuGIuPPJBQuh1BS2"><div class="spacer"></div> You’d been asked to attend this one by Captain Lewellyn, on your way back to Meander’s capital. And here you are, in Welhom’s plaza: snow worn thin by the crowds and the lights of the torches. Barrels of ale had been rolled in, tables and a stage set up where entertainers took their turns—musicians, jugglers, dancers; even once a contest in axe-throwing.<div id="menu-Ns-NuGIuPPJBQuh1BS2" class="flyout"></div></div><div class="message desc" data-messageid="-Ns-NwGLHvZ5DEaF1Ly9"><div class="spacer"></div> You joined this celebration long after it’s started, and may well see it to its end. The sky’s getting dark, and many have trickled away. The barrels seem to be running dry. One couple had retreated to the outskirts to dance to unheard music. The only other fighter for Meander, a young Azeri, sits at a table going on and on about their wartime exploits, about all the action they’d seen. Must have been going on for an hour.<div id="menu-Ns-NwGLHvZ5DEaF1Ly9" class="flyout"></div></div><div class="message emote" data-messageid="-Ns-Oiveqxyr8k68KPGF"><div class="avatar" aria-hidden="true"><img src="https://s3.amazonaws.com/files.d20.io/images/382706835/Bp8mFvqNm3A0wx6-YrNMiQ/med.png?1709381493"></div><div class="spacer"></div>Hue is thoroughly drunk after three drinks. <div id="menu-Ns-Oiveqxyr8k68KPGF" class="flyout"></div></div><div class="message general" data-messageid="-Ns-OivhRtnkOD-FUm2w"><div class="spacer"></div><div class="avatar" aria-hidden="true"><img src="https://s3.amazonaws.com/files.d20.io/images/382706835/Bp8mFvqNm3A0wx6-YrNMiQ/med.png?1709381493"></div><span class="tstamp" aria-hidden="true">March 02, 2024 6:22PM</span><span class="by">Hue:</span>No, I feel fine. To Saelong and Ciar, it looks like a building that might be more at home in Strath.<div id="menu-NsZy_wyumkZAr7c1Gnq" class="flyout"></div></div><div class="message emote" data-messageid="-NsZzTaRd_a8bc-x0n5_"><div class="avatar" aria-hidden="true"><img src="https://s3.amazonaws.com/files.d20.io/images/382654682/fKb5-AraitZRXtNPpc7GkQ/med.png?1709345167"></div><div class="spacer"></div>Raagnasar sets the dire wolf carcass down near the entrance<div id="menu-NsZzTaRd_a8bc-x0n5_" class="flyout"></div></div><div class="message desc" data-messageid="-Nt7Sepz4He1MVV7RV5m"><div class="spacer"></div> START<div id="menu-Nt7Sepz4He1MVV7RV5m" class="flyout"></div></div><div class="message desc" data-messageid="-Nt7Sj8pjL0wyWNgrt16"><div class="spacer"></div> The party forces their way through the doors, then struggles to push them against the howling blizzard until they slam shut. It’s no longer freezing, but it remains cold. The wind howls outside, whispering through gaps in the door.<div id="menu-Nt7SoE5oKBBlUAKXDej" class="flyout"></div></div><div class="message desc" data-messageid="-Nt7SrX0zMq9IpScgkVG"><div class="spacer"></div> You find yourself in a hall, quiet and still. Benches and tables lay pushed up against boarded windows.<div id="menu-Nt7SrX0zMq9IpScgkVG" class="flyout"></div></div><div class="message desc" data-messageid="-Nt7Sy1kshYMGRwSa7Oz"><div class="spacer"></div> To your left is a countertop, like a reception, and to your right, a wooden sign with only two words: Contemporary Art. 		<tbody><tr><td>Cost</td><td>1 Reaction, 1 MP</td>

Before the ally rolls, guess the raw result of the d20 roll. If you are within Charisma/2 of the roll, the attack hits if it were to miss, or deals 1 additional damage if it were to hit.</td>
	
		</tr><tr><td>Allowance</td><td>+/-<span class="inlinerollresult showtip tipsy-n-right" title="Rolling floor(0.5*4) = floor(0.5*4)">2</span></td>

</div><div id="menu-NuFcm26dp3Z6aKvs5te" class="flyout"></div></div><div class="message desc" data-messageid="-NuFd92Ie7EKqilJxGle"><div class="spacer"></div> Together, Saelong and Ciar know that the spell circle is a component in casting powerful spells—Meteor included. The basic theory is that three components are required: an incantation, usually words very carefully chosen; a gemstone conduit; and the spell circle itself.<div id="menu-NuFd92Ie7EKqilJxGle" class="flyout"></div></div><div class="message general you" data-messageid="-NuFd92P9wcQm6Hf4a4k"><div class="spacer"></div><div class="avatar" aria-hidden="true"><img src="https://s3.amazonaws.com/files.d20.io/images/383380810/4YCsMKFqNfj2d9usAQH5ng/med.png?1709771061"></div><span class="tstamp" aria-hidden="true">March 30, 2024 6:34PM</span><span class="by">Lt. On watch, you swear you can hear whispers, coming from the walls, coming from the hole above. You think of the nightmares lying in wait. The chill makes you shiver heedless of how many blankets you attempt to pile on. Asleep, you are plagued by dreams of burning.<div id="menu-NvNfas69xI6pMlhdmVD" class="flyout"></div></div><div class="message desc" data-messageid="-NvNfasB3HP8zNl0AjqF"><div class="spacer"></div> Time passes. The light from above scarcely changes, but one moment you are asleep, and the next you know it is time to prepare for the next day.<div id="menu-NvNfasB3HP8zNl0AjqF" class="flyout"></div></div><div class="message desc" data-messageid="-NvNfuK7qcpNepzj9mJJ"><div class="spacer"></div> The party regains half their maximum HP or 3, whichever is higher; and all their MP—but because of the conditions, 	<caption>Grapple</caption>

		<tbody><tr><td>Roll</td><td><span class="inlinerollresult showtip tipsy-n-right" title="Rolling d20 + 3 + 3 = (<span class=&quot;basicdiceroll&quot;>5</span>)+3+3">11</span></td>
	
		</tr><tr><td>Description</td><td>The target must meet or exceed your check with either a Grappling check of their own or a DEX check. If they fail, you are both Grappling until the start of your next turn. While Grappling, you both suffer -2 Defense, are unable to move, and cannot make weapon attacks or attacks of opportunity. An effect that forcibly moves you or your target may end the Grapple early.</td>

	<table>
